hive_text_custom.text: : So, thanks for telling me about the ballet and
, but I’m really more into sports and things like that. Do you know of any other things you can do in New York?
. There are a lot of events for a sports enthusiast in New York. We’ve got basketball. The Knicks play. They’re an NBA team. We’ve got baseball. The Yankees and the Mets play, and there’s a
. Yankees fans hate Mets fans and Mets fans hate Yankees fans.
: Right. They have two baseball teams.
: Exciting. We even have a Subway Series. Well, it used to be a Subway Series because the teams would play different stadiums for about a week or so and the fans would just
from one stadium to the other. But I think they recently built one stadium for both teams.
: Oh. Do you think one team is more popular than the other?
: I think probably the Yankees, unfortunately.
: Yeah. My family was a Mets fan and don’t tell anyone else in my family that I said that.
: Oh, so I guess, they don’t
: Oh well. Well, I’m from Canada. I really like hockey. I know that you guys have the Rangers.
: Yeah. We do have the Rangers. They play at Madison Square Garden, so you could easily find, like, buy tickets to see a game there. That’s the same place where the Knicks play.
: Oh, they both play at the same place?
: Maybe, I could go to a basketball and a hockey game.
: You probably could if you stayed long enough. I think they have different seasons, right?
: Yeah. Madison Square Garden is pretty big though, so maybe there’s more than one arena. I’m not sure. I’ve only been there two or three times in my life.
: Well, we also have the US Open, if you like tennis.
: Oh, okay. What about the US Tennis Open but there’s also the US Gold Open. Is that in New York as well?
: In New York? I don’t think the – is it?
: I don’t think that the US Open for golf is in New York. I think – no, I don’t think that’s New York. Yeah. No.
: Okay. Have you seen tennis before?
: Yes, I have. I saw Serena Williams play.
: Yeah. I’d like to see her play.

hive_lesson_quiz.question: 1)  She says the baseball teams have _____ .
2) He already knows about the _____ team.
3) Who plays at Madison Square Garden?
4) She has been to the arena _____  .

hive_text_custom.text: She likes the ballet and all that kind of stuff.
Here, the phrase 'all that kind of stuff' refers to things that are similar to each other. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He is into history and all that kind of stuff.
 I hate paperwork and all that kind of stuff.

hive_text_custom.text: We use 'absolutely' to mean 'yes' but with a lot of emphasis. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
Are you coming to the wedding?
 
Absolutely.

hive_text_custom.text: A feud is a rivalry or argument that goes on for a period of time. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
They are having a family feud.
 The two towns have a feud with each other.

hive_text_custom.text: Fans would just switch back and forth.
When you 'switch back and forth' you alternate between two things. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
He kept switching back and forth between two TV channels.
 Sometimes I eat inside, sometimes outside. I switch back and forth.

hive_text_custom.text: They don’t get along with each other?
When people get along well with each other, they enjoy each others company. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
My sisters do not always get along well.
 He gets along well with his boss.

hive_text_custom.text: Here 'is held' means 'happens in' and refers to when or where something takes place. Notice the following:

hive_vocab.examples:
The festival is held in March.
 The game will be held on Sunday at the park.
